data.title: Leadership
data.meta_description: The leadership at TADA is driven by the desire to develop technology that helps companies like yours thrive.
data.text:
Seshadri Guha has over30 years of experience in managing complex business challenges and defining unique approaches for business strategy. His expertise spans from transformation science to technology architecture and business modeling strategies for exclusive solutions. Guha is a founding partner and member of the executive management team at CGN Global. He has led the development of CGN over the past 25 years into an industry leading professional business transformation consulting firm. Guha is also the CEO and Founder of TADAÂ Cognitive Solutions, LLC. TADA is a cloud-based intelligent digital platform that specializes in connecting data, showing the relational nature of information, and allowing businesses to make smart operational decisions and transform the way they function. Guha earned his bachelorâs degree inMechanical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Chennai, hisMasterâs in Engineering Science and Mechanics from Iowa State University and is also an alumnus of the Kellogg School of Management. Guha has been recognized for his professional accomplishments as well as his contributions to his local community. Heâs a member of the Central Illinois Business Hall of Fame, actively supports the American Red Cross of Peoria and is a dedicated member of Easter seals of Peoria Board of Directors.

Harsh Koppula has over 30 years of experience in managing multiple global manufacturing businesses and creating new high growth businesses. He has had particular emphasis on creating new world class manufacturing & supply chain operations and product development centers. Â His expertise spans implementing high velocity Business Transformation, lean manufacturing techniques, rapid improvement of customer/cost/cash approaches, ERP systems, S&OP process improvement, global benchmarking, and Japanese manufacturing techniques. Harsh brings an in-depth understanding of global best practices from his extensive experience with multinational corporations. He has held leadership positions with Schlumberger, General Instrument Corporation, Sumida Corporation, Avon Products and General Mills. He has led global projects for establishing green-field ventures, developing a manufacturing and supply chain footprint extending from North America to Latin America and Asia and managing their operations profitably with high asset efficiency. As the CEO at CGN Global, Harsh provides leadership and guidance in managing CGNâs Global business operations and executing High Velocity Business Transformation solutions. CGN has been named by Forbes as one of Americaâs Best Management Consulting companies in 2017, 2018, 2019 and 2020. Harsh earned his MBA in Operations Management and his MS in Industrial Engineering from the University of Cincinnati and his bachelorâs degree in Mechanical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay.

â

Jim is Tadaâs Chief Financial Officer responsible for finance, accounting, legal and human resources. Jim has over 30 yearsâ experience in the accounting field including auditing, tax and consulting experience. His extensive background includes tax planning and preparation for not for profits, managing a profit center, financial statement preparation in a variety of industries, cash flow analysis, internal control reviews, strategic planning, and controllership. Â His industry experience spans law, healthcare, retail, construction, not for profits, the public sector, manufacturing, and consulting. Prior to joining CGN, Jim was a Partner with one of the top CPA firms in the United States. Â He has extensive experience has provided Jim with the ability to present his work to a variety of audiences, including members of company Board of Directors, venture capitalists, investors, corporate and outside legal counsel, and company staff. Jim received his bachelorâs degree in accounting from Bradley University and has been a CPA for over 30 years. He is a member of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants.

Karthik has 18 years of IT consulting experience in all aspects of software development, including expertise in business intelligence and data reporting (Tada), Program/Project and QA management. His domain expertise includes insurance, telecom, e-com, healthcare, consumer packaged goods (CPG), surety, supply chain management, and aviation. Currently he is a Sr. Director in Delivery & Customer Success implementing Tada solutions for various industries â Insurance, HealthCare, Education and Dealers.

Karthik has more than 8 years in project management and QA management roles that provided experience with delivering mission critical business transformation projects. Karthik is a PMP certified project manager who is very well versed with PMBoK standards of project management. He has participated extensively in RFPs and SOWs, managed projects successfully using fixed price, time, and material contracts from initiation, planning, execution, monitoring & controlling through closing. He has many years of experience in project planning, estimation, scheduling, resource allocation, execution, onsite-offshore coordination, and delivery ownership. Karthik has managed projects successfully using Agile and Waterfall methodologies and is an expert in running the project as a Scrum Master using Agile methodology.

â

Dave has 35 years of business experience. Â At TADA, his responsibilities include leading the Marketing team and the Mid-Market Sales efforts. Â Dave recently retired from Caterpillar Inc. after 32 years where he advanced through 18 roles including Group CFO for Corporate Services, Divisional CFO for Product Support, Controller (Americas) for Caterpillar Financial Services, Managing Director for Telehandlers, Corporate Director of Activity Based Costing, and Corporate Business Analysis Project Manager. Â He gained valuable global experience in each of these roles, including living and working in the UK for five years during his time as a Managing Director. Dave chairs the National Council of Advisors to the Foster College of Business at Bradley University and is a past Chair and current Emeritus Member of the Department of Accounting Advisory Council at Bradley. Â He is also a member of the Bradley University Braves Club Board and a member of the Indiana University Accounting Advisory Board. Â Dave is also a member of the Central Illinois Easterseals Foundation Board of Trustees.

Upen provides valuable insights into the SaaS marketplace and provides guidance in the development and execution of TADA's development and operational strategies.

Upen co-founded and built Riversand Technologies to become one of the leaders in the Product Information Management (PIM) and Master Data Management (MDM) space. Riversand experienced tremendous growth through its innovations and superb team. It became a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant and also won the Great Places to Work award. Riversand was acquired at a very high valuation by Syndigo in May of 2021. Upen guided the company through this journey as the CEO.

Upen holds a Masters Degree in Mechanical Engineering from University of Missouri-Rolla and a

Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering from IT Madras.

â

Jim is currently the President of the Central Illinois Angels, a local group of individuals supporting and investing in local and regional businesses with post-seed capital. Jim also consults with several local companies in their business growth efforts.

Jim recently retired as a Senior Vice President with BlackHawk Industrial, based in Broken Arrow, OK. Â BlackHawk Industrial acquired Jimâs previous company, Sanders Tools and Supplies which was based in Peoria, in 2012. Prior to Sanders, Jim was a Vice President, Major Accounts and International for Advanced Technology Services for 8 years and prior to that was a Vice President, Sales and International Operations for ROHN Industries, also based in Peoria.

Retired Group President, Caterpillar Inc.

Lead Director, W. W. Grainger, Inc.

Lead Director, Entergy Corporation

Board of Directors, Finning International Inc.

â

Stuart L. Levenick is a recently retired group president of Caterpillar Inc. in Peoria, Illinois. During his ten years as a member of Caterpillarâs Executive Office, Levenick managed global businesses spanning marketing, manufacturing operations, engineering, supply chain, procurement and human resources. Levenick has a strong background in marketing and general management as well as broad global experience gained from assignments based in the United States, Canada, Russia, Asia Pacific and Japan.

Levenick graduated from the University of Illinois with a Bachelor of Science degree in forestry and is a Sloan Fellow with a Master of Science degree in management from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

He is a member of the Board of Directors, Lead Director and Corporate Governance Committee Chair of Entergy Corporation, New Orleans, Louisiana; a member of the Board of Directors, Lead Director and Board Affairs and Nominating Committee Chair of W. W. Grainger, Inc., Lake Forest, Illinois; a member of the Board of Directors and Audit Committee Chair of Finning International Inc., Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada; a member of the Board of Directors and Engagement Committee Chair of the University of Illinois Foundation; and a member of the Department of Intercollegiate Athletics Campaign Planning Committee, Urbana-Champaign, Illinois. His past experience includes Executive Board Member of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce; Director of the U.S. China Business Council; Director of the U.S. Russia Business Council; and Executive Director and Chairman of the Association of Equipment Manufacturers, Washington, D.C.

While attending the University of Illinois, Levenick was a walk-on football player who was named team captain, Offensive MVP, earned All-Big Ten honors, and was selected in the 1976 NFL draft. He was inducted into the Greater Peoria Sports Hall of Fame in 2009 and was awarded the University of Illinois Varsity âIâ Lifetime Achievement award in 2014. He was a recipient of the College of ACES Career Achievement Award in 2018.

Vish has built a Silicon Valley career over more than 40 years. He is the founder of Telera and Excelan and has also been the CEO of five start-ups.

Vish is also a renowned venture capitalist with Clearstone Venture Partners, with notable portfolio companies such as PayPal (eBay), Rubicon Project (RUBI), BillDesk (India), SupplyFrame, User Testing, The Hive and The Fabric. He sits or has sat on boards of many companies and is a respected philanthropist dedicated to several social causes.

He is a former president and trustee of The Indus Entrepreneurs (TiE) Silicon Valley, a director at India Community Center and advisor to Silicon Valley Center for Entrepreneurship at San Jose State, a founding board member of San Francisco-Bangalore Sister City Initiative and the Bay Area co-chair for Akshaya Patra, a midday school meal program in India serving 1.7 million meals daily.

Sujeet recently retired from Rockwell Automation where he was responsible for leading the company's global technology strategy and technical innovation, with a focus on making a difference for customers by helping them achieve greater productivity and sustainability. Sujeet's leadership was been instrumental

in driving business growth through next-generation product architecture and platforms, engineering best practices, global technology roadmaps, R&D and technical standards. He leads the company's global R&D and industrial standards development teams in Asia, Europe and the Americas.

Prior to joining Rockwell Automation, Sujeet led R&D in control systems and information sciences for 12 years at Rockwell Scientific Company in Thousand Oaks, California. There he delivered innovative technology solutions to the company's commercial and defense businesses for applications such as advanced avionics, industrial automation and semiconductor production.

Previously, he served as the chief operating officer for a successful start-up company.

Sujeet earned a Doctor of Philosophy degree in electrical and computer engineering and a master's degree in electrical engineering from the University of Florida.
